page.title: 08Industry in Strathmiglo
page.content: The Skene Works were built in 1846. Local people,who did the weaving in their homes,took their cloth along to the Skene Works where the owner bought it from them.Here the cloth was pressed,cut up and sewn into such things as sheets and pillow-cases.In 1850,the owner decided that he could just as easily weave his own cloth.He installed 2 huge boilers to produce the steam that was needed to work the machinery.During the 1920's and 1930's around 60 men and women were employed. They started work at 6 o'clock with a break at 8 o'clock for breakfast.There was a short break at 12 o'clock for lunch and they finished at half-past 5 to 6 o'clock.For a whole weeks work women were paid the same as 25p in our time,the men,37 and a half pence and the foreman 50p.
